content.text: How to Speak and Write Correctly (Devlin) — Subject
In a simple clause, the subject names who or what performs the action (or is described). Identify the subject before the verb.

items: A subject is a noun or pronoun.
It usually comes before the main verb in English statements.
Ask: Who or what does the action?

content.text: How to Speak and Write Correctly (Devlin) — Verbs
A verb expresses action (run, think) or a state of being (is, seem). In simple sentences, it follows the subject.

items: Action verbs: do, make, fly, read
Verbs change form for tense and agreement

content.text: Items in a series should have the same grammatical form: e.g., write, analyze, and present (all base forms).
Strunk (1918) — The Elements of Style (public domain)
